data.text:
Billing Cycles

Water and Sewer bills are sent out quarterly around the first week in January, April, July, and October. Utility bills are due within 20 days of the billing date.

Germantown Utilities crew members collect usage data from your water meter with an automatic meter reading (AMR) device. Our data collection devices read your meter from a distance and store that information in a format that is then downloaded into our billing software to help produce your quarterly billing statement.

In some cases or during certain times of year when we are not able to get close enough to your meter, our data collection devices are not able to communicate with your meter to deliver consumption data. In that event, we provide you with an estimated billing statement, based on your normal usage history for that time of year. Any difference between the amount actually used and the estimated amount billed is corrected automatically when the next regular meter reading is obtained. Ultimately, you pay only for the amount of water actually used.

Germantown calculates the volume charges per 1,000 gallons used.

Have You Recently Purchased/Sold a Home/Condo in Germantown?

If you have recently closed on a property in Germantown, please contact the Utility Department at 262-250-4703, to update your utility billing information and, if applicable, cancel any future AUTOPAY instructions. This simple step will ensure utility invoicing is sent to the correct property owner/tenant.

Not receiving your utility bill does not eliminate the late fee penalty. If you do not receive your bill within five (5) days of when it is normally delivered, please call our office at 262-250-4703.

Payment Options

Utility Bills can be paid:

Automatic Payment Plan: Register online in the Citizen Self Service Portal or click HERE to complete and mail in the form with a voided check or letter from your financial institution. To complete the form and submit online, please click HERE.

Online through the Citizen Self Service Portal.

Beginning with the 3rd quarter utility bill, online payments should be made through the Citizen Self Service Portal. The Village no longer accepts utility bill payments via Doculivery or Point & Pay.

You can also pay your utility bill through your personal online banking.

Summer Sewer Credit - Pool Fills/Lawn Irrigation

Water used for watering the lawn, trees, flowers, car washing, filling pools, etc., does not normally enter the sewer system, accordingly, it is considered appropriate and reasonable to make certain allowances for these non-sewage volumes. As a result, the Village Board has expanded the Summer Sewer Credit to include the 2nd quarter billing cycle.

With the Village’s implementation of the Summer Sewer Credit now covering BOTH the 2nd and 3rd quarter billing cycles, the Village no longer processes additional credits during the 2nd and 3rd quarters for pool fills (or top offs), or sodding or seeding a new lawn at an existing residence.

This broader/automatic ‘summer’ billing adjustment provides residential customers with a discount on sewer charges; and will alleviate the need to call in for additional non-sewage volume adjustments.

Sewer credits may be requested for pool fills (or top offs), or lawn irrigation at an existing residence, if performed outside of the 2nd and 3rd quarters meter readings [approximately mid-September through mid-March.]

In order to receive a credit during this off-season, residents are asked to take a picture of the meter reading immediately before and immediately after usage; and email those pictures, along with the following information, to the Utility Clerk:

Please provide: your full name, address, phone number, utility account number, date of water usage, before/after meter readings, along with pictures of the readings.

Credits will no longer be processed without a before and after meter read and photographic evidence.

One credit per quarter will be considered.
